titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Willy Achim Fiedler papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Frances Heldt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-21T16:17-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

physdesc.extent: 16 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 3 oversize folders

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, notes, memoranda, technical reports, patent applications, clippings, other printed matter, video tape, sound recording, and photographs relating to the German missile development program during World War II, including the "V1," and to postwar American missile development programs, especially the Polaris missile and other submarine launched ballistic missiles.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of all video recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to sound recordings during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Willy Achim Fiedler papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1995.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Received Diplom-Ingenieur (Master of Engineering) from the Technical University, Stuttgart
Designer for the British Aircraft Manufacturing Co. Ltd. in Feltham, England
Received the title of Flugbaumeister (aeronautical engineer) from the Institute for Aviation Research (Deutsche Versuchsanstalt für Luftfahrt, DVL) in Berlin
Designer and test pilot at the Gerhard Fieseler Aircraft Works in Kassel, Germany
Tester of the "V1" missile for Gerhard Fieseler in Peenemünde, Germany
Co-owner and technical director for the Bachem Company in Waldsee, Germany
Owner and manager of Ingenieurbureau Fiedler in Nabern, Germany
Worked at the U.S. Naval Air Missile Test Center (NAMTC) in Point Mugu, California, as part of Operation Paperclip
Received the Distinguished Civilian Service Award from the U.S. Navy
Began work at Lockheed Missiles and Space Company in Sunnyvale, California
Became chief scientist at Lockheed Missiles and Space Company
Retired from Lockheed Missiles and Space Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, scientific writings, experiment notes, memoranda, technical reports, patent applications, clippings, other printed matter, video tape, sound recording, and photographs relating to the German missile development program during World War II, including the "V1," and to postwar American missile development programs, especially the Polaris missile and other submarine launched ballistic missiles. The bulk of the collection relates to these and various other scientific studies and experiments that Fiedler conducted in the decades after his immigration to the United States, organized into a Career File.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged and translated into English by Fiedler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Fiedler's Diplomarbeit, an entry for "Who's Who in Science and Engineering," and his personal notes on his fleet ballistic missile development experience. In English and German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Fiedler had originally placed the papers for this study into a series of different colored folders. The list of folder titles with their corresponding colors appears at the beginning of the first folder. Not all of the folders were found, but for those that were, the original order and folder titles have been retained. The original color of each folder appears in brackets.

scopecontent.p: Folder 12 includes photos of the Fi 256 plane, a group of WWII German officers, the John J. Montgomery award ceremony, and Fiedler with Manfred Hensel. Folder 13 includes photos of various unidentified planes and missiles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Related to the development of Polaris, Modular Multipurpose Missiles, underwater launch, weapons systems, and sub designs. See also: Career File/Projects/Lockheed Missiles and Space Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Related to projects on shelf deployment, STRAT-X, and alpha decay. See also: Career File/Projects/Lockheed Missiles and Space Company and Altran Corporation, and Subject File/William A. Barker.
